comment: Smart Data Models - OperationalLimitType adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/OperationalLimitType/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. The operational meaning of a category of limits.

contents.name: OperationalLimit
contents.comment: The operational limits associated with this type of limit. Default: 'list'

contents.name: acceptableDuration
contents.comment: The nominal acceptable duration of the limit.  Limits are commonly expressed in terms of the a time limit for which the limit is normally acceptable.   The actual acceptable duration of a specific limit may depend on other local factors such as temperature or wind speed. Default: 0

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: direction
contents.comment: The direction of the limit. Default: None

contents.name: limitType
contents.comment: Types of limits defined in the ENTSO-E Operational Handbook Policy 3. Default: None

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
